project.name: JKT
JKT
project.short_description: Game designed and created for students studying Japanese. Flexibility was kept in mind so they could create their own vocabulary lists to load into the game
project.full_description: Game designed and created for students studying Japanese Kanji. Flexibility was kept in mind so they could create their own vocabulary lists to load into the game. Players can select from three different difficulty levels, and the game can be used for other languages as well.

project.name: Chirpper
Chirpper
project.short_description: Audio version of Twitter web application developed for an informatics project class at UCI.
project.full_description: Audio version of Twitter web application developed for an informatics project class at UCI. Project was developed in C# using Unity to develop the front end and Java to develop the server which was hosted on Heroku. The server connected with AWS S3 to store all of the audio files and used a PostgreSQL database in order to store user information.
project.note: Server is disconnected from AWS S3 at the moment. No audio files will be stored or can be played.

project.name: Bubble Bubble Pop Pop
Bubble Bubble Pop Pop
project.short_description: Bubble popping game that used various technologies to allow for multi-touch interaction.
project.full_description: Game was created as an assignment for an informatics class taught at UCI. The input was received from a webcam that was brought into a CCV. The game was developed using MT4J and Java where multi-touch interaction was allowed. The game's objective is to pop as many bubbles, by using a pulling-apart motion, as possible before running out of lives. Once the game completes the user can see their score at the end.

project.name: Guardians of the Arena
Guardians of the Arena
project.short_description: Networked turn-based strategy game developed over two quarters at UCI. Was a finalist at the 2015 IEEE GameSig Showcase
project.full_description: Networked turn-based strategy game developed over two quarters at UCI. Worked together and discussed various aspects of game design and gameplay with each other. The team received advice from mentors from Blizzard Entertainment about game mechanics. The team was able to sit down with various playtesters and receive feedback to improve the game. Guardians of the Arena was a finalist at the 2015 IEEE GameSig Showcase.

project.name: Bazinga Z
Bazinga Z
project.short_description: Mobile shooter game designed that was ranked top of the class
project.full_description: A mobile 2D Side-Scrolling Shooter and Tap and Swipe Battle game set in space! All team members contributed to the GDD and attended weekly meetings about the game's design. Our instructor, Craig Holland of FreezeTag Games, and his friend, David Daniels of Mogol Games, assigned a rank to each of the 10 pitches. Bazinga Z was #1!

project.name: This Website!
This Website!
project.short_description: Website created to link to and display all my projects as well as learn some new languages
project.full_description: Website created to showcase various projects that I have completed over the years. The website attempts to be flexible and adjust to mobile platforms. Bootstrap was used to create aspects such as the carousel on the home page and navigation bar. Javascript was used to load information to pages from an XML file, as well as make the page more responsive.
